intro: Mandirola hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy mandirola, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, Mandirola hirsuta is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
